dmca.title: Goliath 1 - David 0
dmca.body:
---NOTICE--

LAW OFFICES of JOHN P. McGONAGLE 
ATTORNEY AT LAW 
[private] 

September 26, 2005

[private]
Lakeville,MA 02347

Re: Trademark Infringement

Mark: FALCONEIRI CONSTRUCTION 
U.S. Trademark Req. No. 2,980,278 

Dear [private]:

This firm represents Falconeiri Construction, Middleboro, Massachusetts, holder of U. S. Trademark Registration 2,980,278 for the mark "FALCONEIRI CONSTRUCTION." The mark has been in use since 1982 and is widely known and respected. 

It has been brought to my attention that you are using my client's mark under the form FALCONEIRICONSTRUCTION.COM. Please be advised that your use of my client's mark, or any close variation thereof, is a direct and blatant infringement of my client's mark and is causing confusion in the market place.
  
Accordingly, on behalf of my client, I demand that you immediately cease and desist from directly or indirectly using the FALCONEIRI CONSTRUCTION mark, or any close variation thereof. Your actions to date constitute violate the Federal Trademark Laws as well as Massachusetts unfair competition statutes. 

My client will consider its claim for damages and profits resulting from your infringement and unfair competition on the  basis of your cooperation in terminating your infringement of my client's service mark.

In the event that you fail to cooperate and terminate the infringement and unfair competition, my client will be left with no alternative but to bring appropriate action against you in the Federal and/or Massachusetts Courts seeking both injunctive relief and treble damages.

Accordingly, I trust that I shall hear from you by return mail within ten days, advising that all further use of the mark FALCONEIRI CONSTRUCTION, or any variation thereof, has been discontinued.

This letter is written without prejudice to any claim for damages or other relief which my client may have in the event that litigation proves necessary.

Sincerely
[private] 
By First Class Mail and 
Certified Mail, Return Receipt Requested

---RESPONSE---

November 22, 2005 

[private]

RE: Trademark Infringement
Mark: FALCONEIRI CONSTRUCTION

U.S. Trademark Reg. No. 2,980,278 

Dear Mr. [private]: 

In response to your letter dated October 17,1005 - the FALCONEIRICONSTRUCTION.COM website, as presented by Go-Daddy (domain name registrar) has been taken down.

The default "parking" method of Go-Daddy gave us no control over web site content. That has been adjusted. 

[private]

By fax to [private]
By tax to [private] 
By registered/return receipt mail 

---REPLY---

LAW OFFICES of JOHN P. McGONAGLE 
BOSTON, MA 
[private]

December 2, 2005

File No. 7580 235 
	 
[private]
Attleboro, MA 02703-6717

Re:	Trademark Infringement
Mark: FALCONEIRI CONSTRUCTION
U.S. Trademark Req. No. 2,980,278

Dear Ms. [private]:

This is in response to your letter, dated November 22, 2005.

Notwithstanding your actions in taking down the web site, FALCONEIRICONSTRUCTION.COM, as domain.name owner you are responsible for all actions taken with the web site. Therefore, this was a trademark infringement for which you were directly responsible.

Furthermore, you are still in violation of the Federal Trademark laws, specifically, the Anticybersquatting Consumer Protection Act (15 USC 1125(d)). This Act states in part that a person shall be liable in a civil action to the owner of a mark if that person registers a domain name in bad faith that is identical to the owner's mark.

Accordingly, on behalf of my client, I demand that you immediately give up any domain name using the FALCONEIRI CONSTRUCTION or any close variation thereof.

Ifyou immediately give up all rights to PALCONEIRICONSTRUCTION.COM, my client will consider the matter settled. If you do not give up the domain name, my client will take action in the Federal District Court against you for the previous trademark infringement and for continuing cyberpiracy. 

If you wish to settle this amicably, please contact me within ten (10) days providing me with evidence that you have given up the domain name.

This letter is written without prejudice to any claim for damages or other relief which my client may have in the event that litigation proves necessary.

Sincerely,
[private]

By First Class Mail and
Certified Mail, Return Receipt Requested
